Comments: Affordable fresh seafood and oysters in the heart of the French Quarter
Local’s Take: Great Happy Hour -  try an oyster shooter or a margarita with a Grand Ma floater from Nate

Comments: Always changing asian fusion menu in an old 1960’s gas station
Local’s Take: If at peak hours get there early. Space is limited and waits can get lengthy

Comments: Don’t let the Sharpie graffiti covered walls scare you away - Tmoose is amazing
Local’s Take: Get the duck club and a side of duck fat fries - maybe the best hangover cure in Charleston

Comments: 48 beers on tap and a knowledgable staff in addition to eccentric yet delicious food
Local’s Take: Go on a Sunday  - half off large format beers

Comments: $20000+ in singles line the walls of the French Quarter Dive with great fried food and cheap beer
Local’s Take: The fish and chips are maybe the best in Charleston. Start with one of the craft beers on tap and then hide your pride and switch to $2.50 PBRs or Hi-Lifes

Comments: Enjoy bowling arcade games and skeeball and tasty bar food at this eclectic East Side locale
